text: James Edward Young (born January 18, 1926) is an American physicist. He was the first black tenured faculty member in the Department of Physics at Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He was a founding member of the National Society of Black Physicists. Young was a mentor for Shirley Ann Jackson and Sylvester James Gates. He was born in Wheeling, West Virginia. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:Living people Category:American physicists Category:Scientists from West Virginia Category:Writers from West Virginia Category:People from Wheeling, West Virginia
title: James Edward Young
